iciHaiti - Cooperation: The French Development Agency (AFD) Group's Work in Haiti
02/16/2026 08:59:10
As part of the 8th annual Franco-Haitian Friendship Thursdays, the Haitian Embassy in France welcomed Matthieu Discour, Director of the Three Oceans Department at the French Development Agency (AFD), as its guest of honor.
As part of the 8th annual Franco-Haitian Friendship Thursdays, the Haitian Embassy in France welcomed Matthieu Discour, Director of the Three Oceans Department at the French Development Agency (AFD), as its guest of honor. He met with staff and other guests to discuss the AFD's work in Haiti, which spans the areas of governance, education, health, agriculture, and disaster risk management.
This meeting, marked by the quality of the presentations and the richness of the discussions, provided an opportunity to address in depth several key themes related to the AFD Group's work in Haiti over the past 50 years. Discussions focused in particular on the three priority areas of intervention: strengthening the resilience of populations and territories; maintaining the institutional capacities essential to the rule of law and access to basic services; and adapting intervention methods to the specific contexts of project implementation.
In his remarks, the Haitian Ambassador to France, Louino Volcy, emphasized that Haiti intends to shift from a practice of aid to one of investment in order to break free from the structural dependency that aid tends to perpetuate. In Haiti, the aid needed "is a sustainable and solidarity-based investment that helps us become self-reliant." Today, what we need is funding for major infrastructure projects, such as the AFD's support for the construction of the road linking Hinche to Saint-Raphaël.
Particular attention was paid to partnership mechanisms, project submission and review procedures, the role of AFD's local agencies, and the complementary actions of the Embassy, French institutions, and Haitian partners. The discussions also highlighted several flagship projects implemented with the support of Expertise France, concretely illustrating the impact of Franco-Haitian cooperation on the ground.
IH/ iciHaiti

iciHaiti - Cap-Haitien Carnival: Prohibitions
02/16/2026 07:27:18
The Municipality of Cap-Haitien, in conjunction with the Haitian National Police (PNH), informs the public that, in order to guarantee the safety of carnival-goers and residents, and the smooth running of the Carnival festivities, parking and driving any motor vehicle are strictly prohibited along the entire official parade route.
For the three days of Carnival, the affected route is as follows:
APN – Rue 18 A – Rue 5 A – Rue 2 A – Rue 2 L – Rue 18 L – Rue 18 H – Rue 20 H – Rue 20 B – Rue 24 B – Rue 24 A – 24 Boulevard.
This regulation is in effect from 12:00 PM to 3:00 AM during the three days of Carnival (Sunday the 15th, Monday the 16th, and Tuesday the 17th).
Anyone violating this regulation will be subject to the penalties stipulated by current regulations, including impoundment or removal of the vehicle at the owner's expense.
Anyone violating this regulation will be subject to the penalties provided for by current regulations, including the impoundment or removal of the vehicle at the owner's expense. The Cap-Haïtien Municipal Administration and the Haitian National Police (PNH) are counting on everyone's cooperation to ensure a safe, orderly, and festive carnival, under the theme: "Konbit pou yon lòt Okap" (Working for another Cap-Haïtien).
Yesterday, Sunday, the artistic parade took place at 1 p.m. along the following route: Grand Prison, Rue 21 - Rue 20 L - 20 H - 20F - 20A - 18A - 2A - 2L - 18L - 6 p.m. - 8 p.m.
The performance by the groups RAM and Klozz & Bèl Kalkil took place at 5 p.m., along the following route: APN - 18A - 5A - 2A - 2L - 18L - 6 p.m. - 8 p.m. - 20B - 24B - 24A - 24 Boulevard

iciHaiti - OFATMA: Strengthening OFATMA services in the Central Plateau
02/15/2026 09:03:09
Vikerson Garnier, Director General of the Office of Occupational Accident, Illness, and Maternity Insurance (OFATMA), led a delegation of senior managers: Dr. Jacques Dulaurier from the Departmental Directorate Coordination; Dr. Lucien Charley Trévent from the Social Security Coordination Directorate (DCSS); and Ms. Marie Iphania Marcellus, Director of Human Resources. They conducted a series of visits to assess OFATMA's operational capabilities in the Central Plateau region.
In his remarks, Vikerson Garnier reaffirmed his commitment to providing OFATMA-Centre with the necessary resources to increase its efficiency. He also announced the steps taken by the institution to ensure payment to partner hospitals, guaranteeing continuity of care for insured individuals.
The Departmental Director, Rony Destiné, welcomed the delegation and outlined the main challenges facing the Departmental Directorate.
The delegation met with all administrative and technical staff to discuss existing challenges and identify concrete solutions to improve the office's operations.
Continuing his mission in the department, Garnier visited Sainte Thérèse Hospital in Hinche, where he met with Dr. Wolve Irvens Charles, the Central Departmental Director of Health, and Dr. Denold Milsoit, the hospital's Executive Director. He pledged to ensure the necessary follow-up regarding payments to the institution, in order to guarantee quality care for insured individuals in the Central Department.
Furthermore, to address the difficulties related to the production of insurance cards, he announced the deployment, in the coming months, of technical teams tasked with producing insurance cards for the department's insured residents.

iciHaiti - Infrastructure: 86 Beneficiaries Trained for the Implementation of 5 Projects in Baie de Henne
02/15/2026 07:53:26
As part of the Safety Nets Strengthening Program for Vulnerable Populations (HA-J0005), funded by the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB), the Economic and Social Assistance Fund (FAES) recently launched a series of technical training sessions in Baie de Henne for 86 beneficiaries (48 men and 38 women) who will participate in five projects in the region.
Under the expert guidance of CARE, an organization specializing in community interventions, the participants will learn various skills that will enable them to contribute to crucial infrastructure projects.
Initially, they will be carrying out the concrete work on 110.2 linear meters of road in Cité Wallace and the construction of 130 linear meters of fencing for the Baie de Henne police station. For these two projects, 9 men and 6 women will be employed in Cité Wallace, while 14 men and 7 women will work at the police station site.
In a second phase, 30 beneficiaries, including 10 men and 8 women, will be involved in the construction of 160 m³ of gabions in the La Coupe ravine.
Concurrently, 4 men and 8 women will participate in the concreting of 55 linear meters of road and the installation of 5 streetlights at the entrance to the playground in Hâte de Lice.
Finally, in the third phase, 20 beneficiaries, including 11 men and 9 women, will be involved in the rehabilitation of a water point that supplies the Panaceco area. These initiatives aim not only to strengthen local infrastructure but also to improve the living conditions of vulnerable populations through job creation and skills development.

iciHaiti - Health: High-Level Meeting between DINEPA and UNICEF
14/02/2026 09:06:05
Engineer Théophil Ostinville, Director General of the National Directorate for Drinking Water and Sanitation (DINEPA), and Ms. Geetanjali Narayan, UNICEF Representative in Haiti, accompanied by their respective technical staff, participated in a high-level strategic meeting.
This meeting, held within the framework of strengthening institutional cooperation and consolidating the strategic partnership between the two entities, allowed both parties to exchange views in depth on several ongoing priority activities, including emergency interventions in camps for internally displaced persons in the Port-au-Prince metropolitan area, financed by the World Bank, as well as various initiatives related to the construction and rehabilitation of water infrastructure in several regions of the country, financed by the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB).
DINEPA reaffirmed its commitment to continue its efforts to sustainably improve drinking water and sanitation services, in close collaboration with its technical and financial partners, particularly UNICEF.
Access to drinking water, sanitation, and hygiene for children and the most vulnerable populations was a central theme of these discussions, reflecting the shared commitment of both institutions to coordinated, effective, and sustainable responses to the country's humanitarian and structural challenges.

Haiti - PNH: Plaques of Honor and Merit Awarded to Two Canadian Police Officers
02/14/2026 08:17:21
On Friday, February 13, 2026, Vladimir Paraison, Acting Commander-in-Chief of the Haitian National Police (PNH), accompanied by members of the High Command, presented two plaques of appreciation, honor, and merit to two Canadian police officers: Pascal Courtemanche, Lieutenant General of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP), and Malek Hamadene, RCMP Training Coordinator.
These two Canadian officers, nearing the end of their mission in Haiti, received this distinction for their services rendered over the past year to the PNH by providing tactical training to Haitian police officers, aiming to strengthen the institution's operational capabilities.
Paraison took the opportunity to thank and express his gratitude for the invaluable contribution of the RCMP to the PNH's ongoing efforts to curb insecurity and restore public order in Haiti.
At the end of the ceremony, the officers renewed their commitment to serving the Haitian National Police (PNH), stating that they would be honored to return to Haiti for any future missions.

iciHaiti - PNH: New operations to clear roads and dismantle gangs
02/13/2026 09:35:35
Determined to eradicate gang strongholds and clear roads blocked by armed bandits, Vladimir Paraison, the Acting Commander-in-Chief of the Haitian National Police (PNH), announced new offensives dubbed
Operasyon San Kanpe
during a command meeting held this week. The Departmental Directors of the West (DDO-1 and DDO-2), heads of specialized units, Commissioners and Inspectors of the West Region, members of the PNH High Command, and the Commander-in-Chief of the Gang Suppression Force (GSF), Inspector General Godfrey Otunge, participated in this meeting.
Commander Paraison took the opportunity to assess ongoing operations and highlight the significant progress made thanks to police interventions in several sensitive areas, notably Croix-des-Bouquets, Tabarre, Arcahaie, and downtown Port-au-Prince. He also commended the police personnel deployed in the field.
During this meeting, he emphasized the operations dubbed "San Kanpe" which aim to definitively dismantle gangs, clear national highways, and restore state authority. To this end, firm instructions were issued to the various officials involved to do everything possible to achieve the desired results.
For his part, GSF Commander General Godfrey Otunge reaffirmed his troops' commitment to supporting Haitian law enforcement in their fight against terrorist gangs.

iciHaiti - ONA: Opening of a new counter in Pétion-ville
02/13/2026 09:26:03
As part of the strategy of the National Old Age Insurance Office (ONA) aimed at bringing its services closer to its customers, the institution has officially inaugurated a new counter intended for pensioners, insured persons, and the general public. This service point is located at the OASIS Hotel, on Panamerican Street in Pétion-ville.
Designed to meet the needs of users, this new space is modern, functional, and oriented towards the simplification of administrative and financial procedures.
The counter is equipped with a dedicated cash register allowing several types of transactions to be carried out, including the collection of pensions, deposits and withdrawals from savings accounts, the opening of new accounts, as well as other services for pensioners, insured persons, and people interested in ONA products.
Through this inauguration, the National Old Age Insurance Office reaffirms its desire to strengthen its presence in the field and offer a more effective local service, adapted to the expectations of its customers.
In his speech for the occasion, Ronald Bazile, the Director General of ONA, welcomed the opening of this new service window and thanked all the Office teams whose commitment made this initiative possible.

iciHaiti - U17 World Cup Qatar 2026: Our qualified Grenadiers return home
02/13/2026 08:47:33
On Thursday, February 12, 2026, our U-17 Grenadiers, after their 2-1 victory against the Guatemalan national team, the "Matao" (
https://www.haitilibre.com/en/news-46828-haiti-flash-our-u-17-grenadiers-qualify-for-the-qatar-2026-world-cup.html),
and their qualification for the U-17 Men's World Cup, Qatar 2026, returned home where they received a warm welcome upon their arrival at Cap-Haïtien International Airport.
After four previous World Cup qualifications in this age group: 2007 (South Korea), 2019 (Brazil), 2025 (Qatar), and 2026 (Qatar), the goal for this new team is to achieve their first World Cup victory. Our Grenadiers are ready to defend our national colors at this competition, which will take place in November 2026 (official dates are not yet known).
After a break, the U-17 Grenadiers will resume training. The Haitian Football Federation (FHF) will announce a schedule of their preparation stages at a later date.
List of countries qualified for this World Cup: Mexico, Panama, Haiti, Costa Rica, United States, Cuba, Jamaica, Honduras
BF/ iciHaiti
